title: Introduction to Food Microbiology
headline: This free online food safety course explores microbiology to provide the practical skills used to preserve food.
description: Eating healthily plays a crucial role in maintaining one’s health so adopting a realistic and safe food culture is vital to global food security. This food safety and microbiology course establishes the importance of ‘good’ bacteria like probiotics. We study food spoilage, food preservation and foodborne diseases. We also identify career opportunities for microbiologists in the food industry and describe their duties and the challenges they face.
courseDescription:
Food can be the deadliest poison or the most effective medicine. In keeping food safe to earth, it is crucial that we study the microorganisms that live in, produce or contaminate food since good health begins on the inside and at the microbiological level. This course explores  the principles of microbial ecology, psychiatry, metabolism and genetics. We highlight ancient and modern food preservation techniques that can reduce spoilage and make food more attractive and even taste better.

The course then discusses the functions of microorganisms in food. We show you how to improve the microbiological quality of food through effective food processing techniques that ward off microbes. We explain how microbial growth affects the microbiological standards and specifications for nutrition and food items. Using microorganisms for food preservation extends the shelf life of food products while maintaining their quality and safety. With this in mind, we demonstrate several food preservation techniques and their importance to food security.

Finally, the course studies foodborne diseases caused by contamination via microorganisms and microbial toxins. We go through the factors that affect the susceptibility of food to microbial attacks and lay out the classification of foodborne diseases. Lastly, we discuss career opportunities available to microbiologists in the food industry and highlight their responsibilities and challenges. This course examines the science of food microbiology to provide practical food protection skills you can use to keep food safe and delicious.
